desc.simpara: GtkVBox is a box container that packs child widgets in a single column, using the packing methods inherited from GtkBox.

Note that all children in a GtkVBox are allocated the same width, regardless of settings and child requisition size. Widgets taking up less than the allocated width are by default centered within the available area in that dimension.

example.title: Packing child widgets using GtkVBox and GtkHBox

desc.simpara: See also: GtkContainer, GtkBox, GtkHBox, GtkButtonBox, GtkLayout, GtkTable.

constructor.shortdesc: Creates a container for a single column of child widgets.

desc.simpara: Creates a new vertical box container designed for packing a single column of child widgets.
